model-value.desc: Model of the component defining 'open' state; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:modelValue' event) OR use v-model directive

expanded-icon.desc: Expand icon name (following Quasar convention) for when QExpansionItem is expanded; When used, it also disables the rotation animation of the expand icon; Make sure you have the icon library installed unless you are using 'img:' prefix

expand-icon-class.description: Apply custom class(es) to the expand icon item section

toggle-aria-label.description: aria-label to be used on the expansion toggle element

label-lines.description: Apply ellipsis when there's not enough space to render on the specified number of lines; If more than one line specified, then it will only work on webkit browsers because it uses the '-webkit-line-clamp' CSS property!

caption-lines.description: Apply ellipsis when there's not enough space to render on the specified number of lines; If more than one line specified, then it will only work on webkit browsers because it uses the '-webkit-line-clamp' CSS property!

header-inset-level.description: Apply an inset to header (unless using 'header' slot); Useful when header avatar/left side is missing but you want to align content with other items that do have a left side, or when you're building a menu

content-inset-level.description: Apply an inset to content (changes content padding)

expand-separator.description: Apply a top and bottom separator when expansion item is opened

default-opened.description: Puts expansion item into open state on initial render; Overridden by v-model if used

hide-expand-icon.description: Do not show the expand icon

expand-icon-toggle.description: Applies the expansion events to the expand icon only and not to the whole header

switch-toggle-side.description: Switch expand icon side (from default 'right' to 'left')

dense-toggle.description: Use dense mode for expand icon

group.description: Register expansion item into a group (unique name that must be applied to all expansion items in that group) for coordinated open/close state within the group a.k.a. 'accordion mode'

header-style.description: Apply custom style to the header

header-class.description: Apply custom class(es) to the header
